All static findings are false positives: bash command examples were misidentified as shell execution, emoji commit message conventions triggered cryptographic false positives, and the source_url in metadata was flagged as a network finding. No executable code, network calls, or malicious intent exists.

content.user_title: Create GitHub Pull Requests with Issue Links
content.value_statement: Creating pull requests without issue links misses opportunities to close issues automatically and track work. This skill ensures every PR links related issues and uses closing keywords for seamless issue management.
actual_capabilities: Find and link related GitHub issues to pull requests
Use closing keywords (Closes, Fixes, Resolves) to auto-close issues
Generate PR descriptions with structured templates
Add Mermaid diagrams for visualizing complex changes
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only works with GitHub repositories, not other Git hosting platforms
Cannot create PRs without appropriate repository permissions
Does not handle merge conflict resolution

use_cases.title: Enforce issue tracking

use_cases.title: Standardize contributions

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the create-pr skill to create a pull request for the current branch. Link any related issues and use closing keywords.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-issue PR

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bug fix PR that references issue #456. Include before/after comparison and testing notes.

best_practices: Always link related issues before creating PRs to ensure traceability
Use closing keywords (Closes, Fixes) to auto-close issues when PRs merge
Include Mermaid diagrams for complex architectural changes
anti_patterns: Creating PRs without any issue references or closing keywords
Using vague PR titles like Fix bug or Update file
Omitting the related issues section from PR descriptions

faq.question: Which GitHub hosting platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports GitHub only. It uses the gh CLI which is specific to GitHub repositories.

faq.question: What closing keywords does GitHub recognize?
faq.answer: GitHub recognizes Closes, Fixes, and Resolves followed by an issue number. Example: Closes #123 closes the issue when the PR merges.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without GitHub CLI installed?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides instructions for the gh CLI. You must have GitHub CLI installed and authenticated to create pull requests.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides instructional guidance. It does not access files, execute code, or transmit data outside standard GitHub operations.

faq.question: Why are my issues not closing after PR merge?
faq.answer: Ensure you used the correct format: Closes #123 or Fixes #456 in the PR body. The keyword must be uppercase and the issue number must be valid.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHubs default PR template?
faq.answer: This skill adds intelligent issue linking, closing keywords, and Mermaid diagram guidance. It ensures issues close automatically and provides consistent PR structure.
